etymology.description: semantic: 酉 (‘alcoholic drink’) + phonetic: 卒 (OC *ʔsuːd, *sʰuːd, *ʔsud)
etymology.interpretation: 酉 signals a connection to alcoholic beverages, pointing the meaning toward intoxication. 卒 provides the sound, which evolved from Old Chinese readings to the modern pronunciation zuì, while the semantic component anchors it in the alcohol domain.

examples.chinese: 酒后别开车(酒後別開車)，你可能还在微醉(你可能還在微醉)。
examples.pinyin: Jiǔ hòu bié kāichē, nǐ kěnéng hái zài wēizuì.
examples.english: Don't drive after drinking; you might still be tipsy.

examples.chinese: 昨晚他醉得厉害(昨晚他醉得厲害)，今天头疼(今天頭疼)。
examples.pinyin: Zuówǎn tā zuì de lìhài, jīntiān tóuténg.
examples.english: He was very drunk last night and has a headache today.
